oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector

Class SpatialIndexRecordInfoProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.SpatialIndexRecordInfoProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordInfoProvider<Text,RecordInfo>

    public class SpatialIndexRecordInfoProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements RecordInfoProvider<Text,RecordInfo>
    A RecordInfoProvider subclass required when either SpatialIndexInputFormat or SpatialIndexInputFormat need to be used in jobs that require both, an input format class and a RecordInfoProvider class.
    Author:
    hsaucedo

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentRecordInfo

        public RecordInfo getCurrentRecordInfo()

      • getExtraFields

        public boolean getExtraFields(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> extraFields)
        Description copied from interface: RecordInfoProvider
        If the current record contains other fields different to id and geometry that are desired to be stored for fast access, they should be returned here by adding them to the passed map. An example of an extra field is a field containing text that can be used to find the record's location using the MVSSuggest service.
        Specified by:
        getExtraFields in interface RecordInfoProvider<Text,RecordInfo>
        Parameters:
        extraFields - An empty map where the extra fields can be added
        Returns:
        true if extra fields were added. false otherwise.

      • getGeometry

        public JGeometry getGeometry()
        Description copied from interface: RecordInfoProvider
        Gets the geometry of the current record
        Specified by:
        getGeometry in interface RecordInfoProvider<Text,RecordInfo>
        Returns:
        the current record's geometry or null if the record does not have spatial information

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Description copied from interface: RecordInfoProvider
        Gets the id of the current record
        Specified by:
        getId in interface RecordInfoProvider<Text,RecordInfo>
        Returns:
        the current record's id

      • setCurrentRecord

        public void setCurrentRecord(Text key,
                             RecordInfo value)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: RecordInfoProvider
        Sets the record's key and value. The key and value come from the internal InputFormat's RecordReader specified by the user. The record set here should be used to provide the information requested later by calling the getXX() methods. For example: if the InputFormat is TextInputFormat the key will be a LongWrittable and the value will be a Text.
        Specified by:
        setCurrentRecord in interface RecordInfoProvider<Text,RecordInfo>
        Parameters:
        key - A record's key
        value - A record's value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
